values:
wow

such a long time i have been gone

it seemed like a year in that damn place.

a month in rehab.

before that, it was everyday...everyday something to blow my mind even more than the previous day.

now i'm out, and you know what?

i'm doing more heroin than ever
shooting it... feeling it run through my veins, its amazing.
i guess im kind of 'on the run' but whatever.

they've tried to tie me down.

have they no sense? i will NEVER fall into their stupid robotic cycle.
i am meeeeee

1. Take five (random!) books off your bookshelf. 2. Book #1 -- first sentence 3. Book #2 -- last sentence on page fifty 4. Book #3 -- second sentence on page one hundred 5. Book #4 -- next to the last sentence on page one hundred fifty 6. Book #5 -- final sentence of the book 7. Make the five sentences into a paragraph: [1] In my younger and more vulnerable years my father gave me some advice that I've been turning over in my mind ever since. [2] The razor was old, and vicious, and it dispised the blood in his veins. [3] I'll not conceal it, my hand shakes yet as with a wound! [4] Well- get out! [5] We were headed back to the world. [1] The Great Gatsby - F. Scott Fitzgerald [2] The Night Thoreau Spent In Jail - Robert E. Lee [3] The Crucible - Arthur Miller [4] A Raisin In The Sun - Lorraine Hansberry [5] Fallen Angels - Walter Dean Myers

(I forgot who I got this from, if this is yours leave a message and I will credit, sorry ♥ ) I'm kind of a private person, so I only want people that I really really trust read this.... sorry if I don't add you back, don't take it personal ♥ .me.
